title: London tornado of 1091: A tornado thought to be of strength T8/F4 strikes the heart of London.
text: London tornado of 1091: A tornado thought to be of strength T8/F4 strikes the heart of London.

title: Battle of Neville's Cross: King David II of Scotland is captured by the English near Durham, and imprisoned in the Tower of London for eleven years.
text: Battle of Neville's Cross: King David II of Scotland is captured by the English near Durham, and imprisoned in the Tower of London for eleven years.

title: Second Battle of Kosovo, where the mainly Hungarian army led by John Hunyadi is defeated by an Ottoman army led by Sultan Murad II.
text: Second Battle of Kosovo, where the mainly Hungarian army led by John Hunyadi is defeated by an Ottoman army led by Sultan Murad II.

title: The University of Greifswald is established, making it the second oldest university in northern Europe (also for a period the oldest in Sweden, and Prussia).
text: The University of Greifswald is established, making it the second oldest university in northern Europe (also for a period the oldest in Sweden, and Prussia).

title: Anti-Catholic posters appear in public places in Paris and in four major provincial cities supporting Huldrych Zwingli's position on the Mass.
text: Anti-Catholic posters appear in public places in Paris and in four major provincial cities supporting Huldrych Zwingli's position on the Mass.

title: Poczta Polska, the Polish postal service, is founded.
text: Poczta Polska, the Polish postal service, is founded.

title: Kepler's Supernova: German astronomer Johannes Kepler observes a supernova in the constellation Ophiuchus.
text: Kepler's Supernova: German astronomer Johannes Kepler observes a supernova in the constellation Ophiuchus.

title: French king Louis XIII is crowned in Reims Cathedral.
text: French king Louis XIII is crowned in Reims Cathedral.

title: Nine regicides, the men who signed the death warrant of Charles I, are hanged, drawn and quartered.
text: Nine regicides, the men who signed the death warrant of Charles I, are hanged, drawn and quartered.

title: Charles II of England sells Dunkirk to France for 40,000 pounds.
text: Charles II of England sells Dunkirk to France for 40,000 pounds.

title: Premiere in Milan of the opera Ascanio in Alba, composed by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, age 15.
text: Premiere in Milan of the opera Ascanio in Alba, composed by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, age 15.

title: American Revolutionary War: British General John Burgoyne surrenders his army at Saratoga, New York.
text: American Revolutionary War: British General John Burgoyne surrenders his army at Saratoga, New York.

title: American Revolutionary War: British General Charles, Earl Cornwallis surrenders at the Siege of Yorktown.
text: American Revolutionary War: British General Charles, Earl Cornwallis surrenders at the Siege of Yorktown.

title: Britain takes control of the Dutch colony of Curaçao.
text: Britain takes control of the Dutch colony of Curaçao.

title: Former leader of the Haitian Revolution, Emperor Jacques I of Haiti is assassinated after an oppressive rule.
text: Former leader of the Haitian Revolution, Emperor Jacques I of Haiti is assassinated after an oppressive rule.

title: Eight people die in the London Beer Flood.
text: Eight people die in the London Beer Flood.

title: Bellini's third opera, Il pirata, is premiered at Teatro alla Scala di Milano
text: Bellini's third opera, Il pirata, is premiered at Teatro alla Scala di Milano

title: First The Open Championship (referred to in North America as the British Open).
text: First The Open Championship (referred to in North America as the British Open).

title: Nineteen people are killed in the Cullin-la-ringo massacre, the deadliest massacre of Europeans by aborigines in Australian history.
text: Nineteen people are killed in the Cullin-la-ringo massacre, the deadliest massacre of Europeans by aborigines in Australian history.

title: Thomas Edison files a patent for the Optical Phonograph (the first movie).
text: Thomas Edison files a patent for the Optical Phonograph (the first movie).

title: Guglielmo Marconi's company begins the first commercial transatlantic wireless service between Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, Canada and Clifden, Ireland.
text: Guglielmo Marconi's company begins the first commercial transatlantic wireless service between Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, Canada and Clifden, Ireland.

title: Bulgaria, Greece and Serbia declare war on the Ottoman Empire, joining Montenegro in the First Balkan War.
text: Bulgaria, Greece and Serbia declare war on the Ottoman Empire, joining Montenegro in the First Balkan War.

title: RCA is incorporated as the Radio Corporation of America.
text: RCA is incorporated as the Radio Corporation of America.

title: Al Capone is convicted of income tax evasion.
text: Al Capone is convicted of income tax evasion.

title: Albert Einstein flees Nazi Germany and moves to the United States.
text: Albert Einstein flees Nazi Germany and moves to the United States.

title: The body of Communist propagandist Willi Münzenberg found in South France, starting a never-resolved mystery.
text: The body of Communist propagandist Willi Münzenberg found in South France, starting a never-resolved mystery.

title: World War II: a German submarine attacks an American ship for the first time in the war.
text: World War II: a German submarine attacks an American ship for the first time in the war.

title: German troops execute the male population of the villages Kerdyllia in Serres, Greece.
text: German troops execute the male population of the villages Kerdyllia in Serres, Greece.

title: The Burma Railway (Burma–Thailand Railway) is completed.
text: The Burma Railway (Burma–Thailand Railway) is completed.

title: The Holocaust in Poland: Sobibór extermination camp is closed.
text: The Holocaust in Poland: Sobibór extermination camp is closed.

title: A massive number of people, headed by CGT, gather in the Plaza de Mayo in Buenos Aires, Argentina to demand Juan Perón's release.
text: A massive number of people, headed by CGT, gather in the Plaza de Mayo in Buenos Aires, Argentina to demand Juan Perón's release.

title: Archbishop Damaskinos of Athens becomes Prime Minister of Greece between the pull-out of the German occupation force in 1944 and the return of King Georgios II to Greece.
text: Archbishop Damaskinos of Athens becomes Prime Minister of Greece between the pull-out of the German occupation force in 1944 and the return of King Georgios II to Greece.

title: The first commercial nuclear power station is officially opened by Queen Elizabeth II in Sellafield, in Cumbria, England.
text: The first commercial nuclear power station is officially opened by Queen Elizabeth II in Sellafield, in Cumbria, England.

title: Donald Byrne and Bobby Fischer play a famous chess game called The Game of the Century. Fischer beat Byrne and wins a Brilliancy prize.
text: Donald Byrne and Bobby Fischer play a famous chess game called The Game of the Century. Fischer beat Byrne and wins a Brilliancy prize.

title: Scores of Algerian protesters (some claim up to 400) are massacred by the Paris police at the instigation of former Nazi collaborator Maurice Papon, then chief of the Prefecture of Police.
text: Scores of Algerian protesters (some claim up to 400) are massacred by the Paris police at the instigation of former Nazi collaborator Maurice Papon, then chief of the Prefecture of Police.

title: The 1964–65 New York World's Fair closes after a two-year run. More than 51 million people had attended the event.
text: The 1964–65 New York World's Fair closes after a two-year run. More than 51 million people had attended the event.

title: The 23rd Street Fire in New York City kills 12 firefighters, the fire department's deadliest day until the September 11, 2001 attacks.
text: The 23rd Street Fire in New York City kills 12 firefighters, the fire department's deadliest day until the September 11, 2001 attacks.

title: Montreal: Quebec Vice-Premier and Minister of Labour Pierre Laporte was murdered by members of the FLQ terrorist group.
text: Montreal: Quebec Vice-Premier and Minister of Labour Pierre Laporte was murdered by members of the FLQ terrorist group.

title: OPEC imposes an oil embargo against a number of Western countries, considered to have helped Israel in its war against Egypt and Syria.
text: OPEC imposes an oil embargo against a number of Western countries, considered to have helped Israel in its war against Egypt and Syria.

title: German Autumn: Four days after it is hijacked, Lufthansa Flight 181 lands in Mogadishu, Somalia, where a team of German GSG 9 commandos later rescues all remaining hostages on board.
text: German Autumn: Four days after it is hijacked, Lufthansa Flight 181 lands in Mogadishu, Somalia, where a team of German GSG 9 commandos later rescues all remaining hostages on board.

title: Mother Teresa is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
text: Mother Teresa is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: The Department of Education Organization Act is signed into law creating the US Department of Education and US Department of Health and Human Services.
text: The Department of Education Organization Act is signed into law creating the US Department of Education and US Department of Health and Human Services.

title: As part of the Holy See–United Kingdom relations a British monarch makes the first state visit to the Vatican
text: As part of the Holy See–United Kingdom relations a British monarch makes the first state visit to the Vatican

title: The 6.9 Mw Loma Prieta earthquake shakes the San Francisco Bay Area and the Central Coast with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). Sixty-three people were killed.
text: The 6.9 Mw Loma Prieta earthquake shakes the San Francisco Bay Area and the Central Coast with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). Sixty-three people were killed.

title: Peaceful Revolution: The East German Politburo votes to remove Erich Honecker from his role as General Secretary of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany.
text: Peaceful Revolution: The East German Politburo votes to remove Erich Honecker from his role as General Secretary of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany.

title: Having gone to the wrong house for a Halloween party, Japanese exchange student Yoshihiro Hattori is shot and killed by the homeowner in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
text: Having gone to the wrong house for a Halloween party, Japanese exchange student Yoshihiro Hattori is shot and killed by the homeowner in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

title: Russian journalist Dmitry Kholodov is assassinated while investigating corruption in the armed forces.
text: Russian journalist Dmitry Kholodov is assassinated while investigating corruption in the armed forces.

title: Train crash at Hatfield, north of London, leading to collapse of Railtrack.
text: Train crash at Hatfield, north of London, leading to collapse of Railtrack.

title: Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze'evi becomes the first Israeli minister to be assassinated in a terrorist attack.
text: Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze'evi becomes the first Israeli minister to be assassinated in a terrorist attack.

title: The pinnacle is fitted on the roof of Taipei 101, a 101-floor skyscraper in Taipei, allowing it to surpass the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur by 56 metres (184 ft) and become the world's tallest highrise.
text: The pinnacle is fitted on the roof of Taipei 101, a 101-floor skyscraper in Taipei, allowing it to surpass the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur by 56 metres (184 ft) and become the world's tallest highrise.
